Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add project-based workflow and status bar

Transform Terminal IDE into a project-based IDE like VS Code/Cursor:
- App opens to a welcome screen \(blank slate\)
- User opens a folder which becomes the project root
- Status bar at bottom shows current directory and git branch

New files:
- src/shared/types/project.ts: ProjectInfo interface
- src/main/services/ProjectService.ts: Project management service
- src/renderer/stores/projectStore.ts: Zustand store for project state
- src/renderer/components/WelcomeScreen.tsx: Welcome screen with Open Project button
- src/renderer/components/StatusBar.tsx: Status bar showing path and git branch

Modified files:
- src/shared/types/ipc.ts: Add project:open, project:close, project:getCurrent channels
- src/main/ipc/handlers.ts: Add project IPC handlers
- src/preload/index.ts: Add project namespace with open/close/getCurrent/onUpdated
- src/renderer/App.tsx: Integrate project state, conditional rendering, status bar
- src/renderer/styles/index.css: Add welcome screen and status bar styles
- src/main/services/PersistenceService.ts: Add projectPath persistence
- src/main/index.ts: Restore project on startup
- src/renderer/components/NewSessionDialog.tsx: Default cwd to project path

Features:
- Welcome screen shown when no project is open
- Folder picker dialog via "Open Project" button
- Status bar displays folder path \(left\) and git branch \(right\)
- Git branch polled every 5 seconds with auto-update on change
- Project path persisted and restored on app restart

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
